channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Whatever happened to ... the race to cure HIV? There's promising news
item.description: At the International AIDS Society meeting this year, a young woman from South Africa spoke. She is the first Black woman from Africa to be potentially...

item.title: South Korean President Lee to meet with Trump in Washington on Monday
item.description: At a summit meeting in Washington, D.C., on Monday, the U.S. and South Korean presidents will discuss modernizing their 71-year-old alliance and flesh...

item.title: China Evergrande Delisted From Hong Kong Stock Exchange
item.description: China Evergrande, delisted from the Hong Kong Stock Exchange on Monday, leaves behind a giant pile of debt and a long line of desperate creditors.

item.title: Katherine LaNasa Earned Her Role in ‘The Pitt’ the Hard Way
item.description: The actress received an Emmy nod for her performance as a seasoned E.R. nurse, a woman who has seen it all and lived to keep fighting. So has LaNasa.

item.title: These fish may feel pleasure while being groomed by other fish
item.description: An experiment with threadfin butterflyfish finds that these fish may experience pleasure while being cleaned by bluestreak cleaner wrasse — suggesting...

item.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia detained by ICE during Baltimore check-in
item.description: The detention, which was expected, happened after Abrego Garcia walked into the Immigration and Customs Enforcement building in Baltimore for a check-...

item.title: Expecting on the Front Lines: Motherhood in Ukraine’s Military
item.description: Pregnant Ukrainian soldiers say they are fighting for the future of their country and for their children.

item.title: Trump threatens Chicago with National Guard. And, lessons from Katrina, 20 years later
item.description: Trump threatens to send National Guard troops to Chicago, similarly to what he has done in the nation's capital. And, Trump and South Korean President...

item.title: The Typical American College Student Is Not Who You Think
item.description: As a fight over the future of elite higher education consumes university leaders and politicians, most college students live in a very different world...

item.title: Philadelphia Transit Cuts Take Hold, and Commuters Begin to Feel the Pain
item.description: A budget shortfall has led the city’s transit authority to cut its bus and rail services by 20 percent.

item.title: France Summons U.S. Ambassador Charles Kushner Over Antisemitism Comments
item.description: The new American envoy, Charles Kushner, said that France was not doing enough to protect its Jewish citizens, a charge the government in Paris said i...

item.title: Trump Relies on Personal Diplomacy With Putin. The Result Is a Strategic Muddle.
item.description: For President Trump, consistency is less important than leader-to-leader diplomacy.

item.title: Four Journalists Among Those Killed in Israeli Strikes on Gaza Hospital, Officials Say
item.description: Gaza-based reporters said the four had worked for various international media outlets. The Israeli military confirmed its forces had struck the hospit...

item.title: Expecting on the Front Lines: Motherhood in Ukraine’s Military
item.description: Pregnant Ukrainian soldiers say they are fighting for the future of their country and for their children.

item.title: German Prosecutors Charge American With Attempted Spying for China
item.description: The authorities provided few details about the case, the latest in a series of apprehensions in Germany of potential Chinese spies.
